title: Refactor redirects to use tower-http

labels.name: E-pr-welcome
labels.description: The feature is welcome to be added, instruction should be found in the issue.

labels.name: C-refactor
labels.description: Category: refactor. This would improve the clarity of internal code.

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Effort: medium. A moderate amount of work.

body:
reqwest supports defining redirect policies, and provides a few common ones. That support was later ported to [`tower_http::follow_redirect`](https://docs.rs/tower-http/latest/tower_http/follow_redirect/index.html). To reduce duplication, and to make sure the `tower-http` code has all the improvements reqwest gets, we should just make reqwest depend on the one from `tower-http`.

Note: the public APIs are a little different. To prevent a breaking change, we should make the refactor simply internal.

## Implementation steps

Currently redirects are handled manually with this [loop](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/blob/2fd902ebbf20d77d901c5d84cdd04b39421bba4a/src/async_impl/client.rs#L2730) inside `PendingRequest`. Once a response is received, it checks if a redirect is required, and then loops again, or returns the response.

- Make it so `ClientRef::hyper` field is `FollowRedirect<HyperClient>`.
  - Create an internal struct that implements `tower_http::follow_redirect::Policy`, while holding the `reqwest::redirect::Policy` inside it.
  - Remove that the policy is stored on the `ClientRef` (since it is now stored in the middleware.
- Remove the `loop` mentioned above.
  - Make sure any other code related to redirects is handled by the middleware (such as removing sensitive headers).
